DataElement.preferredName: Heart Ejection Fraction Lower Limit of Normal Laboratory Procedure Lab Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The institutional lower limit, in percentage of 100, of normal for how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Heart Ejection Fraction Lower Limit of Normal Laboratory Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the institutional lower limit of normal for how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A hollow muscular organ which receives the blood from the veins and propels it into the arteries. It is divided by a musculomembranous septum into two halves -- right or venous and left or arterial -- each of which consists of a receiving chamber (atrium) and an ejecting chamber (ventricle). SYN cor, coeur.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).

Property.preferredName: Ejection Fraction Lower Limit of Normal Laboratory Procedure
Property.preferredDefinition: The ejection fraction (or, more correctly, left-ventricular ejection fraction, often abbreviated LVEF) is a measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber. (Wikipedia):The bottom of the normal range for a particular laboratory result.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.longName: Measurement of Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction
Concepts.definition: A measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber.

The lowest value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the value as a percentage of 100.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
